qas.question: How long did it take for Myanmar to recover from the collapse of it's first kingdom ?
Did the Mongol invasions of Burma leave any lasting signs?

answers.text: Shan migrants who arrived with the Mongol invasions stayed behind

qas.question: Who was involved merger of the smaller states into the two largest factions of Myanmar ?
What is the name of the kingdom that became dominant along the coastline of Myanmar?

context: Pagan's collapse was followed by <a0_0>250 years<a0_0/> of political fragmentation that lasted well into the 16th century. Like the Burmans four centuries earlier, <a1_0>Shan migrants who arrived with the Mongol invasions stayed behind<a1_0/>. Several competing Shan States came to dominate the entire northwestern to eastern arc surrounding the Irrawaddy valley. The valley too was beset with petty states until the late 14th century when two sizeable powers, <a2_0>Ava Kingdom and Hanthawaddy Kingdom<a2_0/>, emerged. In the west, a politically fragmented Arakan was under competing influences of its stronger neighbours until the <a3_0>Kingdom of Mrauk U<a3_0/> unified the Arakan coastline for the first time in 1437.
